TextSection.Contents: Kandori fleck retina is a rare, genetic retinal dystrophy disorder characterized by irregular, sharply defined, yellowish-white lesions of variable size that are distributed mainly in the nasal equatorial region of the retina, with a tendency to confluence, that are not associated with any vascular or optic nerve abnormalities. They frequently manifest as mild and stationary night blindness.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
